website_summaries.verdict: If pasta is in your plans, the Duxtop cooktop features a speedy Fast Boil button.
pros: Fast Boil and Keep Warm buttons
Built-in digital timer with 1-minute increments up to 10 hours
Auto-pan detection shuts unit off after 60 seconds
Heats pan best when it's directly over heating element
cons: Top is slick, so keep an eye on your pans

customer_reviews.title: Overall quality and performance is excellent.
customer_reviews.text: The cooktop is well constructed with appealing design features. Controls are intuitive and simple to use. Noise level is low. As with all induction cooktops in this class, heat uniformity depends largely on the thermal properties of the cookware. The induction coil is approximately 4” in diameter. Large diameter, shallow pans will develop a hot spot at high power settings. Lower temperature settings for these applications is recommended. Simmering, in large, mostly filled pots displays no such problem. At lower temperature settings, emulating a slow-cooker is simple and effective. I use, and recommend, heavy, induction compatable ceramic cookware, similar to that shown in the photograph (Vermi).
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Bouvier

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Temperature Control
customer_reviews.text: While the unit looks nice, is well-designed in term of appearance and appears to be easy to control and use-- it has a FATAL flaw. The temperature controls are completely WRONG. I tested this and found these results (see photos for confirmation): Set: 100, Actual after 20 minutes: 129 Set: 120, Actual after 14 minutes: 180 Set: 140, Actual after 30 minutes: 187 Set: 160, Actual after 18 minutes: 201 Set: 180, Actual after 11 minutes: 212 The inaccuracy would be tolerable if it was consistent, but it is not. I don't know enough about these cooktops to know what the problem might be--but it obviously does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Valdis Amatnieks

customer_reviews.title: Great product but it tears fast with time
customer_reviews.text: So i have been using this product for almost 7 months now, and i got a spilleage of liquid, something that should be "normal" but the product died, after disassembling it and looking on how the water entered the product, it seems the plastic is suffering from tears from the heat-and-cool cycles it has been only trough the last months, which is not much. I really like the product but this is some kind of design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Hidalgo Rionda

customer_reviews.title: Worked once then broke, no help from the company.
customer_reviews.text: I tested this out before I left for a trip I wanted to use this on. It worked well with my induction pot, heating up very quickly. The first time I tried to use it while on the trip it said it was on and working but wouldn't heat up. I tried for about 20 minutes before I gave up and looked to see what I could do to fix the problem. The return window ended literally the day before and the company didn't offer any sort of help after that time. Huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Megen Decker

customer_reviews.title: Best lighting deal yet!
customer_reviews.text: This cook top is amazing! I have a Rosewill cook top that I really like, but compared to the Duxtop there is no comparison. The Duxtop gives you so much more control. You can set it as low as 150' F7, so if you want to temper chocolate or make fondue cheese look no further. Has a 10 hour countdown timer for those long cooks like beans or making Spegettie sauce. Worth the $99.00 regular asking price, but at $69.00 lightning deal was a steal!
customer_reviews.author: srobideaux

customer_reviews.title: You won't look back
customer_reviews.text: Once you use an induction cooktop you will never use your old fashioned burners again. Or only of you have to because you have 50 in your dinner party. I got this one because the burner ring is a little bigger than my $65 Waring. I am not sure it makes that much of a difference but you gotta have 2. You will see what I mean after you buy your first one. Just make sure you have the right pots and pans. If a magnet sticks to them you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Power

customer_reviews.title: This thing can barely boil water
customer_reviews.text: First, I am using quality induction cookware which worked great on my old cooktop. Using same cookware with this cooktop. I set it the maximum temp which is above 400 degrees. This thing can barely boil water and can only manage 200 degrees at best. Of course, this literally makes this unit useless. I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: dkh1020

customer_reviews.title: error-error-error
customer_reviews.text: junk, and noisy. apparently quality control is not their strongest point
customer_reviews.author: Deliberately Omitted

customer_reviews.title: Does not last.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third induction cooker and none of them has last over a year. This model like the Evergreen one I purchased died the first time I used it on high power. I expect any product to last longer than 7 months. I love induction cooking but this is getting to be a very expensive way to cook.
customer_reviews.author: MBINA

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable product, do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: 10-month after purchase, the product broken. I left it outside yesterday, and today my wife found that the control panel came off. I took a close look: the control panel was attached to the unit by a very thin and narrow glue tape, so that's why it is so easily broken. Not water proof at all, and it does not withstand the sunlight. Product with very low quality and poor design. Please do not waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Li

customer_reviews.title: Bad for frying wings!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use out on the patio/deck to fry buffalo wings (and other stuff) without stinking up the house from the oil. I used an appropriate cast iron Dutch oven and brought the heat up to temp and let it stabilize for 15-20 mins. I cooked 5-6 wings at a time and the oil temp dropped 50-75 degrees and couldn’t catch up to 375. Next batch I tried 3 wings and still had trouble. Very disappointed. Tried 2 more times with other pots and similar experience. Feels like a waste of money and do not recommend for deep frying
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: NOT WORKING -- Second Attempt! We bought one that lasted 6 months approx. It stopped working. I bought a second one thinking it was a fluke. The second one never worked!!!! They will not take it back or provide any assistance. I am over $200 into this darn thing and I have to buy a third heating source. I wish I never bought this and I wish you wouldn't either!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive design. Read before buying.
customer_reviews.text: I was torn between a 3 and 4 star, but went with 3 because the design is seemingly intentionally deceptive. The induction element only heats up that small inner circle. There is a bigger circle around it, but it means nothing and was clearly added to for no other purpose than than tricking you into thinking the heating area is much larger. Heat will eventually distribute across a pan, but you end up getting a hot center and cool edges on any normal 10 ish inch pan. If you only use small pots and 6-7 inch pans, this will work well. Anything larger and you end up running into many issues due to uneven heat distribution.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: heats quickly, almost no temperature control
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Heats quickly, very efficient. Cons: complicated interface. Temperature control is almost unusable. All of these types of units have some differences between set temperature and the actual temp (~20F), but usually you can calibrate for that. With this unit, water boils furiously at 160F and not at all at 140F, some pans start to boil at 180F. With my old "seen on TV" one I could make hollendaise or simmer liquids. This unit only useful for getting things boiling quickly.
customer_reviews.author: tg

customer_reviews.title: Good in all respects except temperature control.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solidly built and high-powered unit. My only complaint with it is that the temperature control is absolutely terrible. Even with a very heavy cast-iron pan, it vastly overheats and burns things like eggs and sandwiches. I verified with a watt meter that the manual is correct: it states it always runs either off or at half power when in temperature control mode. This is way too much power to prevent overheating. I need to find an induction cooktop that proportionately controls power depending on how much heat is required for the item being cooked.
customer_reviews.author: Steve McCollum

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: You simply cannot go wrong with this portable induction cooktop. It's a completely different level of control when it comes to managing temperature for various types of cooking. Upgrading to an induction cooktop or cooktop range is very expensive. This is a great option for someone who wants induction technology without spending a fortune. Very happy with the product. Albeit there is a catch. Once you cook with this, you'll be hard pressed not to want to upgrade your current range to induction. : )
customer_reviews.author: AJames

customer_reviews.title: Possibly doesn't heat evenly
customer_reviews.text: I use it for all of my cooking needs. I notice that my large, 12" frying pan will only brown food properly if it is in the middle of the pan. Food on the outside edges will take much longer to eventually brown. I am not sure, but it could be failure on the part of my pan which is brand new and claimed that it could provide even heating. I believe that I read some other reviews regarding the Duxtop and some folks said that they had the same issue as myself. But that would be my only complaint.
customer_reviews.author: BoatioCapt

customer_reviews.title: A useful kitchen appliance
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Duxtop for three months and use it almost every day. One needs pots or skillets whose bottoms attract a magnet but I had some and cast iron works fine. It is spectacular when coupled with my Presto pressure cooker. Green vegetables like beans, broccoli, kale, etc go from start to a serving plate in six minutes. My cast iron skillets got a new life since they don't work well on a glass-top stove. This is like a gas burner but with more control. My only conplaint is I wish they had charged a bit more and put in a quieter fan. Definitely a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: ThomasG

customer_reviews.title: Use heavy pans
customer_reviews.text: This Duxtop Induction cooktop has a much more responsive touch panel than the iSiler on the left. I think it's because the controls are separate from the cooking surface. It's also faster. However, be aware that the coil is still only about 6.5" in diameter so you need to use heavier pans or pans with triple ply bottoms and give it time to evenly heat before putting your food in - otherwise, you will get a ring of burned on food. I've seen it recommended that you should start at a low power setting and gradually raise it to more evenly distribute the heat. If you pay attention to these limitations, you will have a great experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ron S

customer_reviews.title: Great induction cooktop
customer_reviews.text: I especially like that I can see the timer and the temperature/power level at the same time. This is a great cooktop. It cooks well and cleans up well. I've been using a Duxtop cooktop for 3 years now to do almost all my stovetop cooking. The only time I use the electric range in my apartment is when I have to cook more than one think at a time. I use the temperature setting for the lower-temperature cooking and the power level for higher temperature cooking. All my recipes have come out just delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Denizen

customer_reviews.title: Not a great induction cooktop. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this product in between ranges, until my new one arrives. For quick small things like eggs, it works fine. My issue is that I tried to boil a pot of water for pasta, and it just couldn’t get the water boiling. I ran it on high power for 20 minutes, and the water never boiled. I took a thermometer to it, and it barely chase it to 199 degrees after all that time. Also, the pans only heat up in the center (4-5”). So if you don’t have nice thick pans, plan to burn a lot of food.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Detroit

customer_reviews.title: Fast!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so great! Boils water in a heartbeat, immediate temperature boost and drop when needed, easy to operate and clean. There is a default 10-minute timer that you can turn off. I thought I would not like this aspect, but in fact it’s an important safety feature, as it turns out. The element works faster than I do, so I am grateful for the fact that it turns itself off when I get distracted and walk away from it.
customer_reviews.author: Liz King

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know what to expect never using and induction burner before but have wanted one. You pan has to be magnetic to work. You feel no heat coming from the burner, just the pan that is heating up. So much cooler than elec. burner or gas burner. So looking forward to making soup on it this winter. I would recommend this to anyone wanting and induction hotplate.
customer_reviews.author: Harpo

customer_reviews.title: So awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Boils fast, temperature control, automatic-off timer, enough said. You just have to use the right type of pans, enamel coated cast iron works great with this, but there is a weight limit, so if you are using a 13.25 qt. Staub, by the time you add the ingredients you are probably over the limit. Take care and be well!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth R. Harp

customer_reviews.title: Great appliance
customer_reviews.text: We have a regular glass top electric range, but I do most of the cooking on this induction cooktop. It is faster than the conventional range, and has better temperature control. The only drawback is the on & off switch - it is difficult to wipe the unit clean after using it without activating the on & off switch. Be better if the switch were in a different spot.
customer_reviews.author: Gary N Ca

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love induction cooking. I Have use this in cooking all the time in Europe and absolutely love induction cooking. This particular one is not only aesthetically pleasing but does a marvelous job. I literally do most of my cooking on the burner rather than the gas burners that I have. I just wish your customer service was a little more helpful when I called them do you understand specific features. Which explains my four-stars overall
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: If You Don't Have One. Get One.
customer_reviews.text: Gas and old school electric burners only turn about ONE THIRD of energy into heat. So .66¢ of every dollar you spend on gas/electric is wasted. These things are over 80% efficient; which also means a kettle of water that takes 8 minutes to boil on the stove is ready in THREE minutes on the DUX. We use this so much that we're preparing to run a 220v line to the kitchen for an eventual induction top range.
customer_reviews.author: Crawdaddy

customer_reviews.title: Good heat but not so controllable.
customer_reviews.text: Heat control seams to be out of sink hard to keep at correct temperature, boils quickly. The digital buttons are too sensitive and can be pressed with very little pressure making a towel our slight touch change the settings. Good surface area and not too Loud. Depending on the surface you sit it on it slides around too easily. I have had several of this type of device and would rank it 3 verses the others.
customer_reviews.author: DBPSWLA

customer_reviews.title: Replacing my gas stove
customer_reviews.text: I love this induction cooktop. It’s easy to use and easy to clean. I cooked a fresh pot of pinto beans from scratch in 2 hours and the texture and flavor were incredible. I really like that it has 20 different settings so I can cook all sorts of stuff. I only use iron skillets and stainless steel pots so I like that this induction cooktop only works with those types of pots/pans. In addition, I bought this product renewed so it looks, smells, and feels brand new but the price was 35% lower. I have now replaced my gas stove and am loving all the home cooked meals.
customer_reviews.author: Ada C

customer_reviews.title: Choose the temperature settings cautiously
customer_reviews.text: It definitely takes some getting used to but I am glad I purchased it. I had some problems using it initially but I'm pleased with the responsiveness and help I have received from Secura. The cooktop itself will continue to be a learning process for me and I don't think it will be my first choice for cooking. But I was super impressed with Secura and the dedication they showed in making recommendations to help me with the product. If I could rate their customer service separate from the cooktop, I would give customer service 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Not consistent heat
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product to boil water fast, but unfortunately if you are trying to do any other cooking it won't work well because it won't keep consistent heat. Tried to make bacon on medium heat, it took the pan to searing then seemed to stop giving any heat for a minute then brought the temp back up to searing. Next I tried to caramelize onions and it once again brought it to high simmer then stopped for a minute then high simmer then stopped for a minute... it was very much like cooking with a bad electric radiant stove top. Both times I used the 5 setting. I now only use it for boiling pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Our range broke down and we were having issues with getting new one delivered. We purchased this to help in the meanwhile. 1. Unboxing was easy, no assembly required. 2. The cooktop was light and easily potable. 3. We used it for 4 days without having any issues. 4. For the cost, worth the investment. I would recommend this for people who are in the market for one.
customer_reviews.author: P. G.

customer_reviews.title: Best for boiling water
customer_reviews.text: WE bought this for more efficient water boiling, comparing to gas store, this induction cooktop boiled a big pot of water (we often cook noodles this way) very quickly, most importantly it did not generate heat in the room , this is very helpful during a hot summer day. It is also very nice that the heat dose not transfer to the pot handle or the cover handle, a nice convenient cooking top to have around.
customer_reviews.author: Meina

customer_reviews.title: Love this gem
customer_reviews.text: I have it sitting next to my high-end Thermador gas range, which I have only used about 3x since purchasing the Duxtop portable stove. It cooks great, is easy to clean and fun to work with. Super responsive temp control. As a bonus, I never before realized how stinky cooking with gas is until you don't use it. I'm looking to remodel my kitchen and go from gas to induction cooktop. I wanted to try induction out before committing. I will definitely put in an induction cooktop to replace my gas stove as part of the remodel.
customer_reviews.author: Constance Miller

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Just received my induction cooker yesterday I used it for the first time tonight sautéed some fresh mushrooms than cooked a skirt steak works perfect i was able to control the temperature no problem and this was my first attempt ay using induction cooking.This looks like it is a great product some reviews complain about the noisy fan I did not experience any loud noises The controls are easy to use and it heats up the pan very fast
customer_reviews.author: Ralph D'Alessandro

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't Sure however, Exceeded our Expectations
customer_reviews.text: We were not sure about this when we purchased this, however, after sever uses we are considering changing out our Gas cooktop for an all induction cooktop. Water boils at an incredibly fast rate and the pots and pans do not get hot on the handles like when cooking on a gas stove top. Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Richard T

customer_reviews.title: Makes cast iron cooking a possibility!
customer_reviews.text: With a glass stovetop cooking with cast iron was always out of reach until we decided to try induction. After lots of research I landed on this guy and we haven't looked back. Our lodge doesn't slide around on here, it just stays put. Easy temperature control and great results! Easy to clean and doesn't leave the countertop hot. A little loud but is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Larger unit with multiple temperature controls
customer_reviews.text: It’s a larger unit, with multiple controls. I bought for my son who is a chef, and lives on his boat. He was very specific about temperature control and a unit that wouldn’t heat up the small area in a boat. He is happy with it, but the only downside is he can hear a very high pitch sound when it’s heating up.
customer_reviews.author: Kat F.

customer_reviews.title: poor T control, noisy
customer_reviews.text: poor temperature control and poor accuracy, set temp for 180, water boils constantly (using cast-iron pot and lid) AND rather large swings in temperature (10-15 deg) during basic use (measured with surface T probe) fan runs all the time and is noisy, louder than frig or dishwasher + heats fast +/- OK uniformity, using all-clad or cast-iron
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: Digital display is terrible.  Must be directly over display to see or you just see 8's.
customer_reviews.text: Disliked the display. Must be directly over it to see correctly or you just see a bunch of 8's. Disliked the fact that the touch screen was very sensitive. Just a touch moves the scale 2 or 3 numbers. Disliked the Lock feature. Once you lock the touch screen you cannot unlock it without turning off the unit and adding all the info back in. Real pain when using the timer. Looks nice though, easy to clean, seems to cook well.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Extremely poor heat distribution. Only heats in the very center of pan. Unusable for cooking
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this, and have used it in entire day for prepping a weeks worth of meals. So far the ducks top burner works as advertised. No surprises. I found the instructions to be very clear. But, you have to understand the limitations of the single burner induction method of cooking. It’s not for everybody. But, for me it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: John Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Precision cooking instrument a treat to play!
customer_reviews.text: After spending weeks reading and rereading reviews until I could recite most of them by heart, I picked this magnet cooker and wow! Being my first experience with this kitchen magic, I am pleased to the max! The precise control of temperature allows me to brew teas and coffees with a precision for top taste. Cooking my fave, buckwheat groats, was a dream. And my Calphalon pots work great! No fire means that my cats won't accidentally get lit by jumping on a gas burner and the house burn down. Oh my, where has this been all my life. What a treat!
customer_reviews.author: Bo Nose

customer_reviews.title: This is our second Duxtop Induction Burner Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I really like this induction burner. It heats much faster than our other lower priced Duxtop burner. Works very well. We are trying to move to entirely induction for our stove top. My one complaint is that on this model, the back legs are not rubber and do not stay in place. The front two legs are rubber and don't move but the back two are solid plastic and are not vary stable.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Browne

customer_reviews.title: Good boiler - not for slow simmer
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Doesn’t maintain temp setting - set it at 140 and varies 120-160. Does boil n cook foods very quickly. I don’t know if other brands hold a temperature more steadily.
customer_reviews.author: Denali Delmar

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! Lots of power! Works without an issue!
customer_reviews.text: Works excellently, a very efficient cooker. It's very powerful so go easy on the heat output settings when cooking. I find the default to work just fine, putting the heat output up higher would probably end up burning most things cuz itll cook faster on the outside than the inside. This product has plenty of power, just make sure you have kitchen equipment that is compatible with it, not just any pot or pan works with this.
customer_reviews.author: ShadowSlayer2056

customer_reviews.title: Fast cooking
customer_reviews.text: I love this cooktop and the ease of use for all my cooking. I use this for almost all the cooking I do except baking of course. The unit is laid out very nicely and controls are easy to read and select the best temp for all stovetop cooking. The speed with which it cooks food is amazing and clean up is so easy. Rating: #5+
customer_reviews.author: James H. Couch

customer_reviews.title: Only the inner ring heats
customer_reviews.text: The heating coil is only the size of the inner ring (about 5 inches). When I use it with a 10" skillet, the middle of the pan gets smoking hot and the rest of the pan is 200+ degrees F cooler. Unfortunate considering how expensive this was.
customer_reviews.author: dw

customer_reviews.title: Great for holidays
customer_reviews.text: This portable induction cooktop works great. Bought it for thanksgiving holiday because you can’t have enough burners to cook and heat food during any holiday dinner. What I like best is the ability to set it by temperature but it also have the high-medium-low mode for those who prefer it. Also has the power to boil water really fast. Really great.
customer_reviews.author: LicheeNut

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy again. The temperature control on this induction cooktop basically sucks. It’s either boiling or not boiling. There seems to be no in between adjustment to get a slow simmer or even a slow boil. It’s either a fast boil Or nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S Weber

customer_reviews.title: Duxtop Portable Induction Cooktop
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Duxtop induction cooktop. I have a small gas oven/range in my apartment, which doesn't allow for precise temperature control or accurate cooking times. Also, the kitchen itself is very small and gets hot rather quickly, and using an electric appliances help. I've really been blown away by how great this induction cooktop has been - I am now a total induction convert and I look forward to using it regularly moving forward.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Works ok. Could be more accurate for temp settings.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife, and she uses it pretty much every day. The fact that your not heating up your kitchen during the summer is awesome. The temperature settings are a bit off. Setting on simmer 140*, it doesn’t simmer. Setting on 160* it boils. Boils water incredibly fast though. I can cook eggs perfectly with no crusties on bottom of my eggs. (And I’m a man!) Those cheap ceramic copper pans makes it for easy cooking and cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: This cooktop works great.
customer_reviews.text: I've never used induction cooking before but wanted something other than the stove during the summer when it is already very hot in the kitchen (west facing windows). I am very pleased with this cooktop. It heats up food fast and cools down rapidly after use. The only very minor problem is that even slight touches can change the settings unless one uses the lock. This mainly occurs when wiping down the cooktop after use as even a slight touch to the on/off button will turn the cooktop back on if there is a pot on it. All told though, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: mouse

customer_reviews.title: Really like this product.
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that this has a safety lock. I also like that it times out if you forget your cooking. Super fast to heat up. Won’t turn on unless there’s a pot on the stove. Unfortunately, there is a high pitch noise that people with intact hearing say is
customer_reviews.author: M Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase whether you have gas or electric
customer_reviews.text: We moved into a new home 5 years ago in Florida. No gas available! We are both cooks. I swapped out the electric for induction. I became an induction devotee. We recently moved into an apt with electric only. First thing I ordered was this burner. Caramelized onions to perfection. Still have to play with temp control because my previous induction had power only. It is sitting by my cooktop permanently!
customer_reviews.author: nellapaul

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit
customer_reviews.text: I love induction cooking. I just moved to a different home that has a Jen Air electric stovetop and if I could change it out, I would in a heartbeat. I miss the induction stovetop that I had installed in my prior home kitchen renovation. My current solution is the Duxtop 9600LS and am pleased with the purchase. If fits nicely near my stovetop and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Elna

customer_reviews.title: Great little cook top
customer_reviews.text: Used primarily for morning coffee to do pour overs or French press. This portable does not boil as fast as a 220v cooktop but still way faster than a traditional electric cooktop. Used to cook items a few times and temperature control works well. Have used this daily for about a month now and am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Natto

customer_reviews.title: Have to buy cookware made for induction cooking even tho instructions says otherwise
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say that you can use it with any cookware that magnet sticks to. That is not true. So far, all my cookware that magnet sticks to shows an error (EO) and barely heats up and beeps continuously. So, gonna order the Duxtop cookware which, of course, was manufactured specifically for the Duxtop units! I do like that it is quiet compared to my last unit and that the power has 20 settings to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great Style, Quality and Value
customer_reviews.text: I had done considerable research before deciding on Duxtop. Paired with le Creuset cookware I now find I much prefer this over gas or standard electric. It heats pan faster and holds temperature better for more even cooking. I mounted as a side burner to my outdoor grille (well protected from weather) and now do most cooking outside. Whether making delicate omelets, braising or searing meat it performs very well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Swartz

customer_reviews.title: Fast, accurate temp settings, uses less electricity than the range and take up little space.
customer_reviews.text: I have cast iron and stainless steel pans so I use the Duxtop to cook everything. It boils water very quickly and heats a fry pan for searing before my flat top range would even be warm. I rarely use my range anymore. I literally cook everything on the Duxtop . Love love love it. The 20 heat settings plus temperature setting make it easy to boil, simmer or slow cook. The timer is a great help. I can set it to slow cook for 5 hours and go to bed knowing it will shut off in the night. Great feature.
customer_reviews.author: John Powers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, looks good, heats quickly
customer_reviews.text: I like this burner. It replaced a popular "wave" burner. This one is easy to clean, looks nice on the counter, and seems to heat faster than the one I used to have. My only concern is that it slides very easily on the counter; so much so that I need to get a silicone mat for underneath. But I do like this burner.
customer_reviews.author: N. Koelkebeck

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: We needed cooking facilities for our home until we can redo our kitchen. After extensive research we decided on these induction cooktops. They are easy to use, instructions were clear and easy to implement and the cooking power is awesome. Foods cook well and quickly. The order arrived as promised, well packed and on time. We would definitely recommend these cooktops. Once we redo our kitchen we plan to keep one and share one with a family member.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t boil water
customer_reviews.text: After 42 minutes at high temperature (10), this induction cooktop burner couldn’t boil 6 1/2qts of water in a 12qt pot. Guess if you want to boil water for single portion pasta this might work but not for family cooking, no way. I had high hopes in this product after reading many reviews. Hope this keeps others from being disappointed too.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Groh

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these at our place and just bought 1 each for our grown kiddos. If you don't have gas, these are a necessary kitchen tool in my opinion, they warm up much faster than the regular electric oven cooktop and it's super easy to use. Highly recommended purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid for daily cooking.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this constantly for 8 months and I love it. I live in a Granny unit and do most of the cooking for my family in a very tiny kitchen. I'm a cast iron lover, so induction is my friend. I love the timer & one touch boil feature. It's super easy to clean and it feels like it's going to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Puddletown Sue

customer_reviews.title: use proper  cookware  and just buy this cook top it will not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my cabin..spend the money on proper induction cookware .. THIS LITTLE JEM WILL BOIL 3QTS OF ICE COLD SPRING WATER IN 7 MINUTES I AM 100% SATISFIED WITH THIS PURCHASE I would definitely recommend to family and friends..all that glorious praise for my induction cooktop .(but I have only had it in daily use for about 90 days)..i will report and update after 6months of use.. This has been one of my best purchases from Amazon and I order alot of items..probably 80% of my personal shopping is done off Amazon..sorry to say..but Amazon ROCKS
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Great price and value
customer_reviews.text: Replaced another, much older induction top with this more powerful, better looking, safer burner. This burner is fast, has simple controls, temps increase/reduce at the touch of a finger and very quickly. Sturdy item, would add another to use instead of my electric range top.
customer_reviews.author: meme.

customer_reviews.title: Temperature settings not sensitive enough
customer_reviews.text: The unit will boil water for two cups of coffee in less than two minutes. Unfortunately the 20 temperature settings are also 20 degrees apart which is not sensitive enough to properly cook. I do see induction units out there with 5 degree settings, which I will try. This unit might work for a college student in a dorm room, but for us it will only be used for boiling water for pour over coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Randy D Smith

customer_reviews.title: Please stay on
customer_reviews.text: It kept turning off when I used a cast iron pan on it. It was not even on the highest setting. GRRRRRRRRRRRRR
customer_reviews.author: WorkingTowardsBetter

customer_reviews.title: Heat control, speed and induction readiness for your pots and pans
customer_reviews.text: Very good heat control and ability to boil water far more quickly than my halogen/electric cooktop. I was surprised to learn that my All-Clad stainless steel cookware works with induction. Try a magnet on your pots and pans -if the material is magnetic it is useable on this unit.
customer_reviews.author: rhi

customer_reviews.title: Simply put I love the control this affords me
customer_reviews.text: Simply put I love the control this affords me. I take it to parties to keep my contribution at the proper serving temp. I like it's quick response...a little guesswork at first to find where I wanted to set it for each application but once I determined my preference (and made note of them) it is a breeze to replicate results. I am getting some Waygu beef for a holiday party and I will be using this induction plate to cook it...that's trust.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Better than electric stove
customer_reviews.text: Impressed at how fast this heats. Have only used it on power control but that’s all you need. Plenty of power and plenty levels of control. Able to cook rice now with no more boil over. And yes, you can put a silicon mat over it to keep it clean. Just don’t block the air flow.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Leaps and bounds better than my old electric hot plate! Was surprised my pans worked with it (they were labeled as aluminum but the magnet stuck! Must be some hybrid metal?) Love how quickly it boils water and the precision temperature control.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent portable introduction to induction cooking
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this as we are getting ready to remodel our kitchen and are considering moving from natural gas to induction. This is an excellent portable introduction to induction cooking. It performs flawlessly and has convinced us that induction is, indeed, the way to go. I highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a single, portable method of induction cooking. You will never think of using gas again!
customer_reviews.author: J. Richard Ludgin

customer_reviews.title: Heckuva Hotplate!
customer_reviews.text: Performs as well as our full sized induction cooktop. Way way better than our electric range. We are using hotplate to stir fry, pan fry various cuts of meat and of course boil, steam and simmer. Comes up to cooking temps very quickly. That is what we were looking for and that is what we got. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Chin

customer_reviews.title: Induction cooktop
customer_reviews.text: So there is a learning curve. First note, you will get an error message if you turn it without a pan on it. I made something that after it boiled had to be turned down to simmer. I had to find out what degree simmer is, and then set it too that degree. It was instant!!! Cleanup is a breeze. If you spill on it you can wipe it immediately. Cools to the touch very quickly. So far I am a fan
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Caluza

customer_reviews.title: Great temperature control
customer_reviews.text: Since I have an electric stove top (glass) whenever I would cook an item that needed to be started with high heat then lowered quickly I would have to use two burners. No longer with this induction cooktop. The temperature control is quick and nearly instantaneous. I absolutely love it. I no longer feel I need to convert to a gas stove. I highly recommend this cooktop.
customer_reviews.author: gb

customer_reviews.title: Larger than we thought, but still WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: This induction cooktop gives us the control we need to augment our in-counter cooktop, with the ease-of-use for even quick dishes. We routinely use it for slow cooking over a number of hours, with consistently great results. There is a fan noise, so not silent, but not a big deal in our book.
customer_reviews.author: l.b.

customer_reviews.title: A Real Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this with a cast iron pan and things cook very quickly. Cast iron or carbon steel are a must have with these. The aluminum pans with an add on slice of magnetic metal on the bottom warp and take forever to heat up which is costing money. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of cleaning and how quickly food heats. I like the steady temperature for cooking. It would be nice if a temperature could be programmed manually. However there are a good range of temperatures programmed. I use the cook top almost every day for cooking with my cast iron cookware. I would buy a cook top that could accommodate 12 inch pans if it was available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cooks fast.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the temperature changes are instantaneous, unlike my electric range, making it easier to go from boil to simmer. Since I've never cooked to a known temperature on a range there's a learning curve to find out what temps are best for each type of food. I've tried following guidelines from different online sources but find they are different from my experience. But, overall, I'm very satisfied with my Duxtop.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Signorino

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go in our camper. I use it instead of the gas stove top. It fits nicely on the counter top and there is hardly any mess to clean up. It works great, glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: schion

customer_reviews.title: Love this cooktop!
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved into my RV fulltime and added this cooktop to make meal preparation easier. It's exactly what I needed! Works fast, efficient and easy to use! Quick clean up too. You just can't ask for more! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly Noisy.
customer_reviews.text: While I can't tell you how well it works, I can tell you that its fan is LOUD. Almost as loud as our kitchen exhaust. This rendered it unusable for my purposes. So, back it's headed.
customer_reviews.author: J. Panzer

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: This was a life-saver when we were renovating the kitchen. Things cook fast and water boils so fast. We did not hear any high-pitch sound as some others have indicated, but that could be just us. Very easy to use and clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast, controlled heat
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with our camper, but had to try it out as soon as it arrived. It heated the pan much more quickly than the stovetop - I was surprised and amazed. The chicken cooked up just fine and I was able to adjust the heat downward in the process. It was very responsive. So, just one use so far, but I am very happy with the product and look forward to using it with the camper (whenever we are plugged in!).
customer_reviews.author: Janet L Kleckner

customer_reviews.title: More complicated than expected
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be easy to use and give me an additional burner when having company or holiday meals. However, it was more complicated than I anticipated in just boiling water and cooking pasta. My pasta ended up over-cooked because I did not achieve a boil and put in pasta in just hot water. I will have to go online to see if I can figure out what I did wrong. The enclosed instructions were not very useful.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: finding it a little complicated!
customer_reviews.text: It's quite a bit more complicated than the cooktop we had before with temp controls and power level controls. Not sure which one to use or adjust. I think the temperature variations will be great once we figure it out. Haven't used it enough yet to get it properly figured out. I think it might take a little while. As far as energy efficiency, I have no idea how it does. Delivery was just one day later than we were quoted. No big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Complained that I couldn't get it to work ans was only getting an E0 error. Their quick reply said if you put a compatible pot on it before you power up the error won't appear...they were right! Works great! Bought the portable cooktop to test induction cooking before stepping up to a full installation. Definite getting one now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Roznovsky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it for my daughter's apartment with no stove. It provides instant HIGH heat for cooking and easy to control. My only wish is that the cord would be a little longer with ability to control. The cord is not a good sight to see and I wish I could control it so as to hide it from the counter top.
customer_reviews.author: Umma

customer_reviews.title: Very handy,  portable, and efficient.
customer_reviews.text: I like the precise control this cooktop offers swapping quickly from power to temperature control. Setting the timer and not having to worry about things cooking to long, this is great for steaming eggs or cooking rice or simmering a sauce or chili. Cleans up easy stores conveniently. Very portable too great for keeping meats n cheese sauces warm at parties without overheating or scorching. Very pleased with this unit it's the second dustup unit I've purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Pappy

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: I hear the ringing a bit, but I believe it's because my pan is not perfectly flat. I have this in my lil tiny studio and love it for cooking oatmeal, frying eggs, warming up soup, etc. It's surprisingly quick at it, so don't walk away too long, though the auto-shut-off timer comes in handy for me when I get busy and forgetful. The only somewhat minor complaint is the digital display is way too bright. I can't hardly see what I'm cooking - that light shines like a spotlight up in your eyeballs. I have resorted to covering it with something while I'm cooking. But it would not stop me from buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: tumama

customer_reviews.title: Beats Nu-Wave Hands Down!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this better than a Nu-Wave we used to have. The 1800 watts help to make it more functional and super fast. For stovetop coffee, just turn it on, use the boil setting, once it starts perking turn it down to 4 for about 12 minutes to get deliciously brewed, rich coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Cali Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Hot pot
customer_reviews.text: I only use this to heat a kettle in my downstairs/basement kitchen. But no question, this is fantastic unit. Will update review if unit breaks etc but after two weeks I'm definitely happy with the unit and would recommend. I realize a cheaper unit could probably cover my needs given my narrow usage but this unit is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Abel Brown

customer_reviews.title: It is as good as a one burner stove top
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product in every way. It heats quickly and operates just like an electric burner on your stove. Very sturdy with no worry of pot toppling over, easy clean up and attractive. We have a little galley kitchen with no hook up for a stove so this allows me to cook a real meal using my microwave, convection oven and Duxtop induction burner. I did a lot of research before purchasing. You just have to make sure you use a designated outlet for the burner so you do not overload your outlet.
customer_reviews.author: monamom1

customer_reviews.title: Need hot stuff??
customer_reviews.text: I do all of my cooking on induction hot plates. This one includes some technology that is new to me. I especially like the added power settings which add to controlling the cooking. Seems well made and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: snofan

customer_reviews.title: Well made with nice heat control
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in completing euro mounts from deer skulls. This process takes about 10 hours per skull and I completed three euro mounts using this appliance. It worked very well for my purpose has great heat controller and nice timer function. It definitely seems to be a quality appliance.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Consistent heat at selected setting.
customer_reviews.text: This cooktop is just what I needed. Once you become familiar with the controls, it is easy to regulate and provides consistent heat at the selected setting. I had trouble regulating my regular cooktop. When I would select a setting, the temperature would vary too widely. Either my food would would almost stop cooking or it would burn. The Duxtop does not have this problem. It has a good range of temperatures so fine tuning the heat is not a problem. Nothing stops cooking or starts burning. The cooktop is easy to clean because food splatters do not get burned on around the pan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Updated version of duxtops solid induction line
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated version of duxtop's prior excellently reviewed induction cook-top. Bought this for auxiliary kitchen cooking and boiling water quickly. So far it has performed well and the fan is quieter than some older units I have used. It keeps the temperature within it's stated range but note this also will depend on the efficiency of the pan being used.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Rudkowski

customer_reviews.title: Quality, value & convenience
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and features of the this unit, especially for the price paid. I use a gas stove but sometimes it heats up the kitchen too much in the summer, especially when I have several things cooking at the same time. This cooktop helps reduce the heat, heats quickly and is easy to operate. All of my cookware is All-Clad, regular cast iron and LeCreuset and they all work great on this unit. I also like the fact that the cooktop is portable so I can use it on my screened porch and deck. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: RandyH

product_meta.title: Duxtop Portable Induction Cooktop, Countertop Burner Induction Hot Plate with LCD Sensor Touch 1800 Watts, Silver 9600LS/BT-200DZ
feature_bullets: 【PORTABLE INDUCTION BURNER】Duxtop induction cooktop uses 110/120V 15 amp electrical outlet–standard in all North American homes. ETL listed and built to North American electrical standards. It is lightweight and compact for easy handling and storage. Portable induction burner is perfect for dorm rooms, home kitchen, RV, boats, etc.

【PORTABLE INDUCTION BURNER】Duxtop induction cooktop uses 110/120V 15 amp electrical outlet–standard in all North American homes. ETL listed and built to North American electrical standards. It is lightweight and compact for easy handling and storage. Portable induction burner is perfect for dorm rooms, home kitchen, RV, boats, etc.

【DIGITAL LCD SENSOR】Touch control panel: child safety lock keeps the cooking and timer settings from being accidentally changed once they have been set; fast boil button; keep warm button (for 1-30 minutes at 140°F); up to 10-hour timer button.

【COMPATIBLE WITH MAGNETIC COOKWARE】 In order to use this and any other induction stove, you need to use cookware with a magnetic bottom. The auto-pan detection will shut the unit off automatically after 60 seconds if no cookware, or the incorrect cookware is detected. Compatible with induction cookware having a diameter of at least 5 inches, which ensures a large and uniform heated area.

【100% SATISFACTION】Although induction itself is a noiseless process, there may be high pitched sounds from the cookware due to multiple layers of metals sandwiched together. Please allow the induction cooker to cool down before cleaning. If you have any questions with our product, please feel free to contact our customer service. We will address your concern to the best.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,671 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
